availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Hancock County, Kentucky, farmer. Hardinsburg, Kentucky native. Son of John Sterett and Sallie DeHaven Sterett. Married Elizabeth Haynes Sterett on March 2, 1848. Father of John H. Sterett, Mary Sterett, Sallie Sterett, Henry Sterett, A. Sterett, and William F. Sterett. Farmer in Hancock County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Hancock County in 1860. Member of the Missionary Baptist Church. Member of the Masonic order.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, Unnamed District, p. 53; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, Unnamed District, p. 4; J. H. Battle, W. H. Perrin, & G. C. Kniffin. Kentucky: A History of the State 2nd Ed. (Louisville: F. A. Battey Publishing, 1885), 757-78.
